channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Don’t Forget “Coffee & Art” on October 8!
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 8, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Come to the Mueller Center lobby for this creative and social event, which gives students a chance enjoy a variety of coffee options while participating in different arts-and-crafts activities in a relaxed atmosphere. Stop by to unwind, connect with peers, and engage in creative hands-on projects!
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Graduate Student Appreciation Day Dinner to be Held October 15
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 5:00 PM - 8:00 PM - The Office of Graduate Education and Student Life’s Graduate Experience are excited to invite all graduate students to attend this special appreciation dinner and enjoy an evening of delectable cuisine and engaging conversation as a huge “thank you” for all of their commitment and hard work!
item.author: Students

item.title: “Where Pride Meets Progress” Event to Feature Stories from RPI Alum
item.description: Join the Center for Career and Professional Development on October 11 at 4:00PM EST in DCC 318 for an inviting LGBTQ+ panel, where current RPI students will have an opportunity to hear from RPI alum who identify as part of the LGBTQ+ community. Panelists will join virtually and feature a diverse range of voices, representing different industries and career paths, as they share their personal and professional journeys.
item.author: Students

item.title: Intel Schedules October 9 Information Session for RPI Students
item.description: Students are invited to join Intel for an information session to be held at 6:00PM on Wednesday, October 9. The plan for this session is to provide a company overview and discuss internships and full-time positions; RPI alumni/Intel employee Kawser Ahmed will also discuss his engineering career, followed by a Q&A session.
item.author: Students

item.title: Free Flu Shot Clinics Available for Students October 8, 10
item.description: The Student Health Center will be offering free flu shots for RPI students from 10:00AM until 4:00PM on Tuesday, October 8 in the DCC Great Hallway, and from from 10:00AM until 4:00PM on Thursday, October 10 in the Mueller Center lobby. No appointment is necessary, so just drop by to get your free flu shot!
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications Now Open for 2024-2025 Barry Goldwater Scholarship
item.description: Established by Congress in 1986 to foster and encourage excellence in science and mathematics, the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation runs an educational scholarship program designed to provide opportunities for U.S. undergraduate students with strong academic records and outstanding research potential. The pre-application deadline is Monday, November 25, 2024; the final application deadline for nominated students is Monday, January 20, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: COMM+D to Hold Graduate School Application Essay Workshop
item.description: If you’re applying to graduate schools but aren’t quite sure how to write a personal statement or a statement of purpose, you’re in luck! From 4:00PM to 5:00PM on Wednesday, October 9 in Sage 4510, the Center for Global Communication+Design (COMM+D) will be offering a workshop on writing successful application essays.
item.author: Students

item.title: Hudson Valley Quantum Convening at RPI October 21
item.description: Date: Monday, October 21, 2024 9:30 AM - 11:00 AM - Register for this thought-provoking discussion about quantum computing, including what we have learned so far and the challenges and opportunities to come. The event will feature RPI President Martin A. Schmidt ’81; Congressman Paul Tonko; IBM Research Senior Vice President and Director Darío Gil; and West Point Vice Dean for Engagement and Research Kraig Sheetz.
item.author: Community

item.title: CEE Seminar Series Continues October 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - In a presentation titled “A Research Agenda for Future Mobility: Exploring Innovations, Sustainability, and Smart Transportation Solutions,” speaker Dr. Kevin P. Heaslip II, Professor/Director at the University of Tennessee, will discuss how the landscape of future mobility will be driven by technological advancements, shifting societal demands, and the urgent need for sustainable solutions.

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy Colloquium Scheduled for October 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - This colloquium will feature a presentation titled “Towards Cultural Change in Physics Programs: Discussing action plans and metrics” by Dr. Diana Sachmapazidi of Rochester Institute of Technology.

item.title: MSE Seminar to be Held October 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This seminar will feature a presentation titled “Non-Hermitian photonics with quantum-inspired symmetries and exceptional points” by Li Ge, a Professor of Physics at CUNY.

item.title: Math Colloquium Scheduled for October 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - This Mathematical Sciences colloquium will feature a presentation titled “Wave Turbulence: Why and when it works and open challenges” by speaker Alan Newell from the University of Arizona.

item.title: Chemistry Seminar Series Continues October 8
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 8, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Prof. Dr. Juergen Popp, Institute of Physical Chemistry, Friedrich Schiller University Jena and Leibniz Institute of Photonic Technology, Germany, will speak on “Integration of Biophotonics and Artificial Intelligence: Translational Optical Health Technologies at CeBAI.”

item.title: DotCIO Tech Tip Tuesday: Don’t Take the Bait! - How to Recognize Phishing Email
item.description: Scammers use email to try and steal your passwords, account numbers, Social Security numbers and other personal identifying information (PII), as well as attempt to gain access to your email, bank, and/or other accounts. In order to help all members of the campus community recognize and avoid these types of phishing scams, DotCIO has put together a number of useful tips and resources.
item.author: Community

item.title: Collegiate Store Offering Birthday Specials for Faculty, Staff
item.description:
The Collegiate Store is happy to announce that it will be celebrating RPI faculty and staff birthdays with an invitation to shop for one clothing or gift item at 20% off. Beginning in March 2024, faculty and staff can just come in during their birthday month to get their coupon, which can then be used in-store or online.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
